info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 3:10PM EDT until June 02 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Massachusetts, including the following county, Berkshire. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 310 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Adams, Adams, Zylonite, North Adams State College Athletic Field, East Renfrew, Renfrew, Noel Field, West Summit, Soldiers Memorial Field, Bowens Corners, Rusek Whipple Square, Houghtonville, Hairpin Turn, Briggsville, Braytonville, Little Egypt, Maple Grove, Brayton Hill, Greylock and Savoy Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
